definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
ancient bronze wine holder with 3 legs and loop handle/nobility
to bite words and chew characters (idiom); punctilious about minutiae of wording
tastes as if one is chewing wax (idiom)/tasteless/insipid
to chew/to masticate/to ruminate/to mull over
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)

sentences.english: I am not talking to you. I am chewing bubblegum.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有和你說話，我在嚼泡泡糖。

sentences.english: Local people like to chew it, especially at a wedding.
sentences.chinese: 本地人喜歡嚼檳榔，尤其在婚禮上。

sentences.english: The bus driver chews his sandwich and watches us in the overhead mirror.
sentences.chinese: 司機一邊從後視鏡裏看戲一邊嚼着三明治。

sentences.english: Yo momma's so ugly, she looks like the elephant man chewing on a wasp.
sentences.chinese: 你媽是個醜八怪，活像個嚼咬黃蜂的大笨象。

sentences.english: He is chewing a rubbery piece of meat .
sentences.chinese: 他正嚼着一塊嚼不爛的肉。

sentences.english: He is chewing a rubbery piece of meat .
sentences.chinese: 他正嚼着一塊嚼不爛的肉。

sentences.english: Chew it well. I don't want you to choke.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢嚼，我不想看到你噎到。

sentences.english: Direct use of medlar, mouth chewing absorption of nutrients in more fully.
sentences.chinese: 直接用嘴嚼，對枸杞中營養成分的吸收會更加充分。

sentences.english: If they are still super-chewy, cover the pot again and simmer for up to another 45 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 如果嚼起來還是不太軟嫩，就再蓋上鍋蓋煮45分鐘。

sentences.english: Frances would chew glass if Beatrice said she thought it was a good idea.
sentences.chinese: 如果比說嚼玻璃片是個好主意的話，弗也會這麼做的。

sentences.english: Her audience chewed on its cigars.
sentences.chinese: 她的觀衆兀自嚼着口中的雪茄。

sentences.english: Don't chew the tablets before swallowing, or you may throw them up.
sentences.chinese: 不要把藥片嚼碎再吞嚥，否則你會吐出來的。

sentences.english: Be certain to eat slowly and chew your food extremely well.
sentences.chinese: 要注意慢點喫飯，將食物細細嚼碎。

sentences.english: If I'm chewing something up, all the pieces are mine.
sentences.chinese: 如果把某物嚼碎了，所有的殘碎物就是我的。

sentences.english: Gallerygoers munched on jelly beans while a band played in the nextroom.
sentences.chinese: 藝術愛好者們嚼着糖豆，聽着隔壁一個樂隊的演奏。

sentences.english: The chewing of the gum will keep your mouth busy and spare your fingers.
sentences.chinese: 嚼口香糖會讓你的口腔繁忙，也能騰出你的手指頭了。

definition: to chew/to masticate/to ruminate/to mull over
to wolf down one's food (idiom); to devour ravenously/to gorge oneself
a full mouth of (sth physical)/to have the mouth exclusively filled with (a certain language, lies, promises, etc)
(of food etc) soft/pulpy/(Tw) (of a person) lacking drive/shiftless/lazy
